intro_text: The patrol stumbles across a loner who smells of infection.
decline_text: The patrol dismisses them quickly and heads back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol invites the loner into the Clan for treatment, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} warily {VERB/n_c:0/accept/accepts}.
The patrol offers the loner a place to stay in the Clan for treatment, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/accept/accepts} with a quick nod, unable to speak very clearly.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol offers the loner a place to stay for treatment, but {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} {VERB/n_c:0/refuse/refuses} and {VERB/n_c:0/stumble/stumble} off in a daze.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol threatens the infected cat, but the loner doesn't seem to be listening. In a daze, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/stumble/stumble} off.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol drives the loner off of the territory.

intro_text: The patrol finds a kittypet picking their way through the territory. The kittypet states that they want to help the Clan fight the infection.
decline_text: The patrol turns the cat away. What could a kittypet do to help?

success_outcomes.text: When the patrol offers the kittypet a space in the Clan, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} happily {VERB/n_c:0/agree/agrees} and {VERB/n_c:0/follow/follows} them back to camp with {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} tail held high.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol asks what the kittypet could do to help, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} can't seem to answer. Tail held high, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} hastily {VERB/n_c:0/promise/promises} to gather more information and come back later.

intro_text: While sniffing around the edge of a Twolegplace, p_l feels something hit {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/look/looks} up and {VERB/p_l/see/sees} a kittypet sitting up in the branch of a tree, apologising for dropping their twig while giggling.
decline_text: The cats decide to patrol elsewhere, leaving the kittypet to entertain themself.

success_outcomes.text: When the patrol asks what {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject}{VERB/n_c:0/'re/'s} doing out of {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} Twoleg den with this infection going around, the kittypet shrugs and says that {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} Twolegs cured {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} ages ago, so {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} can still explore. The kittypet can't answer any further questions and quickly leaps out of sight, unsettled by the patrol's persistence to learn more.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l tries to ask the kittypet what they're doing out here, but they're giggling too hard to themself to pay much attention. p_l turns the patrol around, frustrated, leaving the kittypet to their own devices.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: With lashing tails, the patrol threatens the kittypet for being on their territory. The kittypet doesn't seem amused, but when r_c lunges for the base of the tree they've up in, they quickly hop onto a neighbouring branch and disappear.

antag_success_outcomes.text: r_c instantly leaps onto the tree as the rest of the patrol heckles the kittypet to get off of their land. The kittypet yelps and quickly leaps into a neighbouring tree before r_c can get to them, disappearing into the leaves as they flee.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a kittypet, who is immediately apologetic for trespassing. They have some priority_herb The kittypet explains that they're looking for a friend of theirs to attempt to treat their infection.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol agrees to help the kittypet look for {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} friend. Eventually, the group finds {PRONOUN/n_c:1/object}-- an infected rogue hiding in the corner of the territory. Though the kittypet has to return home, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/beg/begs} the patrol to let {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss} friend join the Clan for treatment, and the patrol obliges.

fail_outcomes.text: They try to help the kittypet locate their friend, but the sun begins to set and they haven't found a scent trail. The kittypet departs to head back to their Twolegs, looking dejected and taking the priority_herb with them.
